title: Drawing, "Design for a Vesel (Tableware)", ca. 1675
medium: Black chalk, pen and ink on paper
markings: Watermark at top: bird above triple mount
inscribed: Inscribed in blaxk ink, below at left: 10.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The left half is shown, supported by a dolphin's head. The lowest part of the body is convex; it is decorated with leaves. The part next to it is concave and fluted. The main section is convex. It shows an acanthus rinceau beginning at a shell standing in the center. From a bearded and foliated mask rises a handle shaped like intertwined snakes. The upper part of the body is framed by moldings. Pricked.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Vesel (Tableware)", ca. 1675.
ca. 1675. Black chalk, pen and ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-2564.
